body_html:
I have the same problem when I tried to preprocess pictures before training, maybe it's nothing wrong with tensorflow.
I'm using:

  • Windows Subsystem for Linux (Ubuntu 18.04)
  • python 3.6.5
  • opencv-python 3.4.1.15
Python 3.6.5 (default, Apr  1 2018, 05:46:30)
[GCC 7.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import cv2
python3: Relink `/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libudev.so.1' with `/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1' for IFUNC symbol `clock_gettime'
Segmentation fault (core dumped)

I'm confused now. I'm not sure whether it's the problem of WSL or opencv-python. My codes work fine on Ubuntu16.04 .

body:
I have the same problem when I tried to preprocess pictures before training, maybe it's nothing wrong with tensorflow.
I'm using:
+ Windows Subsystem for Linux (Ubuntu 18.04)
+ python 3.6.5
+ opencv-python 3.4.1.15

```
Python 3.6.5 (default, Apr  1 2018, 05:46:30)
[GCC 7.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import cv2
python3: Relink `/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libudev.so.1' with `/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1' for IFUNC symbol `clock_gettime'
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```
I'm confused now. I'm not sure whether it's the problem of WSL or opencv-python. My codes work fine on Ubuntu16.04 .
